page.title: 07RECREATION IN CALLINGTON
page.content: Because of a regrettable deficiency in sports facilities the halls and grounds of both schools are used by local clubs for{badminton, tennis, {cricket and football,}also a{Keep-Fit group at the primary school. The community hall attached to the Roman Catholic church is used for{ecumenical {youth club,}while the elderly residents on the council estate have their own clubroom in Newport Close. {Bingo and Whist}drives are held at Chyvarhas Home for non-residents, the financial proceeds going to provide amenities for residents. The old Free Methodist chapel in Tavistock Rd is now the property of the{Freemasons - No.557 the Loyal Victoria Lodge - whose lO5 members meet there on the first Monday monthly. An amateur radion club for{C.B.}enthusiasts meets every week at the Tollgate Hotel.
